Package projects.spatial.kdpoint

Class KDPoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • projects.spatial.kdpoint.KDPoint
  • public class KDPoint
extends java.lang.Object

    KDPoint is a class that represents a k-dimensional point in Euclidean space, where k is a positive integer. It provides methods for initialization, copy construction, equality checks and distance calculations. The precision of KDPoints is arbitrary.

    YOU SHOULD ***NOT*** EDIT THIS CLASS! If you do, you risk not passing our tests!

    Author:
    Jason Filippou

    • Field Detail

      • coords

        public java.math.BigDecimal[] coords
        To make matters simple for client code, we will allow the KDPoint's coordinates to be publicly accessible. This makes KDPoints mutable, so deep copies will be required wherever we copy KDPoints.

      • ZERO

        public static final KDPoint ZERO
        The point (0, 0)

    • Constructor Detail

      • KDPoint

        public KDPoint()
        Default constructor initializes this as a 2D KDPoint describing the Cartesian origin.

      • KDPoint

        public KDPoint​(int k)
        Initialize a k-dimensional KDPoint at the origin of the axes.
        Parameters:
        k - The dimensionality of the KDPoint.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the provided dimensionality is < 1.

      • KDPoint

        public KDPoint​(double... vals)
        Initialize a KDPoint with some double values. Implicitly sets the KDPoint's dimensionality.
        Parameters:
        vals - The values with which to initialize the KDPoint.
        See Also:
        System.arraycopy(Object, int, Object, int, int)

      • KDPoint

        public KDPoint​(java.math.BigDecimal... vals)
        Initialize a KDPoint with some BigDecimalvalues. Implicitly sets the KDPoint's dimensionality.
        Parameters:
        vals - The values with which to initialize the KDPoint.
        See Also:
        System.arraycopy(Object, int, Object, int, int)

      • KDPoint

        public KDPoint​(KDPoint p)
        Initialize a KDPoint based on an already existing KDPoint. Since KDPoint is a mutable class, all new KDPoint instances should be created by this copy-constructor!
        Parameters:
        p - The KDPoint on which we will base the creation of this.

      • distanceSquared

        public java.math.BigDecimal distanceSquared​(KDPoint p)
                                     throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Calculate the squared Euclidean distance between this and p.
        Parameters:
        p - The KDPoint to calculate the distance to.
        Returns:
        The squared Euclidean distance between the two KDPoints.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the dimensionality of the two KDPoints is different.

      • distanceSquared

        public static java.math.BigDecimal distanceSquared​(KDPoint p1,
                                                   KDPoint p2)
        A static version of distance calculations. Since the Squared Euclidean distance is symmetric, it's somewhat awkward to have to specify a start and end point, as distanceSquared does, so we provide this option as well.
        Parameters:
        p1 - One of the two KDPoints to calculate the distance of.
        p2 - One of the two KDPoints to calculate the distance of.
        Returns:
        The Euclidean distance between p1 and p2.
